page.title: 19TRADE
page.content: Retail trade - 1 main centre- town centre, with 8 smaller outer centres. Shop survey:- 64% of people asked do the bulk of their shopping at the outer centres and at Derby, Sheffield and Chesterfield for the unusual items. The main centre has the largest open-air market in England. Open 4 days per wk. The central redevelopment was completed in 1981 at a cost of Â£12m. providing new and restored buildings, shops, market place, several large D.I.Y. Stores. There are eight trading estates nearby concerned with the wholesale trade.Manufacturing is similarly placed,e.g. Robinsons'- cotton products, Tube Inv.-cylinders Bryan Donkins-valves, Markham Works- turbines. The town centre has services for finance, transport, entertainment, as well as repairs, professional and retail.
